008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.image.access;
010
011import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
012import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
013import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
014
015/**
016 * A specific vector-valued image accessor for RGB images
017 * (direct subclass of {@link VectorAccessor}).
018 */
019public class RgbAccessor extends VectorAccessor {
020        
021        private final int[] pixels;
022
023        /**
024         * Constructor.
025         * @param ip the associated image
026         * @param obs the out-of-bounds strategy to be used
027         * @param ipm the interpolation method to be used
028         */
029        public RgbAccessor(ColorProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
030                super(ip, 3, obs, ipm);
031                this.pixels = (int[]) this.ip.getPixels();
032        }
033        
034        @Override
035        ScalarAccessor makeComponentAccessor(int k) {
036                return new ComponentAccessor((ColorProcessor)ip, outOfBoundsStrategy, interpolationMethod, k);
037        }
038        
039        public static RgbAccessor create(ColorProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
040                return new RgbAccessor(ip, obs, ipm);
041        }
042        
043        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
044
045
046        @Override
047        public float[] getPix(int u, int v) { // returns an RGB value packed into a float[]
048                float red = componentAccessors[0].getVal(u, v);  //(c & 0xff0000) >> 16;
049                float grn = componentAccessors[1].getVal(u, v);  //(c & 0xff00) >> 8;
050                float blu = componentAccessors[2].getVal(u, v);  //(c & 0xff);
051                return new float[] { red, grn, blu };
052        }
053        
054        @Override
055        public float[] getPix(double x, double y) {
056                float red = componentAccessors[0].getVal(x, y);
057                float grn = componentAccessors[1].getVal(x, y);
058                float blu = componentAccessors[2].getVal(x, y); 
059                return new float[] { red, grn, blu };
060        }
061        
062        @Override
063        public void setPix(int u, int v, float[] valf) {
064                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
065                        componentAccessors[k].setVal(u, v, valf[k]);
066                }
067        }
068        
069        @Override
070        public ColorProcessor getProcessor() {
071                return (ColorProcessor) this.ip;
072        }
073        
074        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
075        
076        private interface ComponentGetter {
077                /**
078                 * Function to extract a particular RGB component from an integer.
079                 * @param rgb a packed RGB integer
080                 * @return a component value
081                 */
082                int get(int rgb); 
083        }
084        
085        private interface ComponentSetter {
086                /**
087                 * Function to insert a particular component value into an integer.
088                 * @param rgb a packed RGB integer
089                 * @param c the component value to insert
090                 * @return the modified RGB integer
091                 */
092                int set(int rgb, int c);
093        }
094        
095        /**
096         * Defines a scalar image accessor for one particular color component.
097         * This is a non-static inner class, which shares data with the enclosing
098         * {@link RgbAccessor} instance.
099         * Note that this subclass of {@link ScalarAccessor} has no ImageProcessor
100         * of is own, but {@link #getProcessor()} returns the original 
101         * {@link ColorProcessor} instance.
102         */
103        private class ComponentAccessor extends ScalarAccessor {
104                
105                private final int k;    // the RGB component index = 0,1,2
106                        
107                private final ComponentGetter[] getComponent = {                        // note the fancy use of lambda expressions!
108                                (rgb) -> (rgb & 0xff0000) >> 16,        // extract red component
109                                (rgb) -> (rgb & 0x00ff00) >> 8,         // extract green component
110                                (rgb) -> (rgb & 0x0000ff) };            // extract blue component
111                
112                private final ComponentSetter[] setComponent = {
113                                (rgb, r) -> (rgb & 0xff00ffff) | (r & 0xff) << 16,      // insert red component
114                                (rgb, g) -> (rgb & 0xffff00ff) | (g & 0xff) << 8,       // insert green component
115                                (rgb, b) -> (rgb & 0xffffff00) | (b & 0xff)                     // insert blue component
116                };
117                
118                private ComponentAccessor(ColorProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm, int k) {
119                        super(ip, obs, ipm);
120                        this.k = k;
121                }
122                
123
124                @Override
125                public float getVal(int u, int v) {
126                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
127                        if (i < 0) {
128                                return this.defaultValue;
129                        } else {
130                                return getComponent[k].get(pixels[i]);
131                        }
132                }
133
134                @Override
135                public void setVal(int u, int v, float val) {
136                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
137                        if (i >= 0) {
138                                int vali = clamp(Math.round(val));
139                                pixels[i] = setComponent[k].set(pixels[i], vali);
140                        }
141                }
142                
143                private int clamp(int val) {
144                        if (val < 0) return 0;
145                        if (val > 255) return 255;
146                        return val;
147                }
148        }
149
150}
